Welcome to pex100’s documentation!¶

pex100 is a Python module providing a complet data analysis workflow for PEX100 phosphoassay data. See details about the array here: http://www.fullmoonbio.com/product/phospho-explorer-antibody-array/. Many parts of the workflow can be easily adapted to any phosphorylation data, including phosphoproteomics. The module runs with both Python 2 and 3. Questions and bug reports: turei.denes@gmail.com.

Reference¶

class pex100.Pex100(dirBase='..', fnIdMapping='PEX100_Layout.csv', fnXlsFullData='AssayData-Cambridge-Peirce-150515.xlsx', fnCombined='bmp8_%s.csv', fnFcTable='fc_%s_%s.csv', fnFcTopTable='fctop_%s_%s.csv', fnFcTopCommon='fctop_%s.csv', fnFuncCat='func_annot_categories.tab', fnFuncTidy='functional.csv', fnKinactTop='kinact_top.tab', ncbi_tax_id=10090, org_strict=True, flex_resnum=True)[source]¶
affected_by(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Returns the UniProt IDs of the interacting protein partners of the phosphorylated substrate which the phosphorylation event affects the substrate’s interaction with.

antibody_id_to_name(aid, unique=True)[source]¶

For one antibody ID returns the protein names and residues as a human readable name. If unique, it uses a counter and appends an additional number in parentheses to make a series of labels unique. The counter is under attribute cntrUniqueLabels.

classmethod array_to_lls(arr)[source]¶

Converts numpy array to a list of lists of strings.

classmethod array_to_string(arr, hdr=None)[source]¶

Takes a numpy array and returns it as a string of tabular.

collect_assay_psites()[source]¶

Collects all phosphosites included in the assay. Result saved to setAssayPsites attribute.

collect_participants(attr, get_participant='get_kinase_uniprot', type_filter='is_phosphorylation', regenerate=False)[source]¶

Collects all kinases from the kinase-substrate interactions loaded from databases. Creates a unique list and saves it to attribute attr.

collect_proteins()[source]¶

Compiles a list of all kinases and substrates.

combined_table(to_file=False)[source]¶

Export a table with number of kinases for each substrate PTM. The table will be saved into daTable attribute, which is a dict of arrays.

Parameters:to_file (bool) – Whether to write table into file.
create_ptms()[source]¶

Creates PTM objects for each PTM on array.

disrupted_by(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Returns the UniProt IDs of the interacting protein partners of the phosphorylated substrate which the phosphorylation event disrupts the substrate’s interaction with.

effect_as_int(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Returns the unambiguous effect as an integer, either -1, 0 or 1.

fc_data_frames(std='none', colname='30min')[source]¶

Creates a pandas.DataFrame to serve as input for kinact. Data frame contains phosphorylation sites and their fold changes.

fc_diff_table()[source]¶

Orders proteins by fold change diff.

fc_list(psites, treatment, signs=False, category=None, std='none')[source]¶

Returns fold change values in one treatment for a list of phosphosites, optionally with signes corrected according to the effect of each phosphosite.

fc_of_annotated_with(annotation, treatment, signs=False, category=None, std='none')[source]¶

Returns the FC values of from phosphosites in one treatment annotated with a certain functional annotation.

fc_table(to_file=False)[source]¶

Creates tables with fold changes, and exports to files optionally. Calculates z-scores, p-values and t-values.

fc_table_to_file(unique=True)[source]¶

Writes FC tables to files.

fc_top_table(unique=True)[source]¶

Writes FC values sorted by maximum difference into file.

static fold_change(val, ctrl)[source]¶

Calculates the fold change as {value}/{control} if {control} < {value} and -1 * {control}/{value} otherwise.

functional_array()[source]¶

Compiles an array of functional annotations.

functional_compare_fc(annotation, treatment, silent=False, return_result=False, signs=False, category=None, std='none')[source]¶

Performs a Mann-Whitney U-test between fold changes of phosphosites annotated or not with certain functionality.

functional_compare_fcs(signs=False, std='none')[source]¶

Compares differences in fold changes across all functional annotations and all treatments.

get_arrays(llTable, vcol)[source]¶

Returns annotations and data as numpy arrays. Requires list-of-lists table and the column number where data values start.

static get_kinase_uniprot(dommot)[source]¶

Returns the UniProt of the kinase from a pypath.intera.DomainMotif object.

get_network(keep_also=[], step1=True, more_steps=None)[source]¶

Creates a subnetwork based on certain criteria.

Parameters:
  • keep_also (list) – List of additional vertex names to include in core.
  • step1 (bool) – Whether include not only direct links but one step indirect connections.
  • more_steps (int) – Include longer indirect connections. This param defines the number of mediator nodes.
get_psite(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

From a phosphosite string representation or substrate UniProt ID, residue name and number separately, returns an uniform tuple representation.

get_regulation_data(key, substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Returns a piece of information from the regulatory sites data about one phosphorylation site.

get_residues(res)[source]¶

Matches residues in string, returns tuples of tuples with residue names and numbers.

get_standards(name, vcol)[source]¶

Gets the values from the standards.

static get_substrate_psite(dommot)[source]¶

From a pypath.intera.DomainMotif object, gets the identity of the phosphosite in a ‘UniProt_[residue][number]’ format.

has_terms_of_category(protein, cat)[source]¶

Returns if one protein has been annotated with any of the terms in one functional category cat.

idmapping()[source]¶

Builds the idmapping table in order to translate the custom names to UniProts already at loading the table.

idmapping2mouse()[source]¶

Creates a dict of names to mouse UniProt IDs.

induced_by(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Returns the UniProt IDs of the interacting protein partners of the phosphorylated substrate which the phosphorylation event induces the substrate’s interaction with.

init_pypath()[source]¶

Initializes a PyPath object for mapping and network building.

static is_phosphorylation(dommot)[source]¶

Returns True if the type of an enzyme-substrate interaction is phosphorylation.

kinact_analysis(std='none')[source]¶

Sets up and runs kinase activity analysis with kinact. Results saved to the dddfKinactResult attribute.

kinact_top(fname=None, threshold=0.2)[source]¶

Prints a table with top results from kinact.

kinase_psite_adj(regenerate=False)[source]¶

Creates and adjacency matrix of kinases and target phosphorylation sites, based on database data. The matrix is a pandas.DataFrame with values of 1.0 if the kinase phosphorylates the site otherwise numpy.nan values. The matrix is saved into the dfKinPsite attribute. This method also builds a dictionary of kinase-phosphosite relationships which will be useful later to query the targets of kinases.

kinases_of_substrate(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Returns the kinases of a substrate.

ll_table_slice(table, col, row, ncol=None, nrow=None)[source]¶

Returns a slice from a list-of-lists table, starting at (row, col), height and width of (nrow, ncol).

load_go(_reload=False)[source]¶

Loads the GO biological process annotations if those haven’t been loaded or reload forced. Also loads the ontology graph as a pysemsim.GOTrees object. This is for lookup of ancestors.

load_ptms()[source]¶

Obtains a list of all kinase-substrate interactions from Signor, phosphoELM, PhosphoSite and dbPTM. Creates a dict dPhosDb where (kinase, substrate) UniProts are keys and list of PTMs are values.

load_seq()[source]¶

Loads protein sequences from UniProt.

static log2_fold_change(fc)[source]¶

Log2 transforms fold change value.

main(network=False)[source]¶

Loads and preprocesses all input data. Runs the whole data processing and analysis and exports files.

mousedict()[source]¶

Reads human to mouse mapping from HomoloGene.

network(extra_proteins=[], edges_percentile=50, pfile=None)[source]¶

Loads and processes the network.

psite_effect(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Returns a tuple of two boolean values. The first is True if the phosphorylation event has a stimulatory effect. The second is True if the phosphorylation has an inhibitory effect.

static psite_from_fc_row(row)[source]¶

Returns phosphosite string representation from a row of and FC array.

psite_inhibitory(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Tells if the phosphorylation site has a inhibitory effect.

psite_inhibitory_unambiguous(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Returns True only if the phosphorylation site is inhibitory and not stimulatory.

psite_kinase_adj(regenerate=False)[source]¶

Creates a dict between psites and kinases. This is for the opposite way lookup as dsetKinPsite.

psite_stimulatory(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Tells if the phosphorylation site has a stimulatory effect.

psite_stimulatory_unambiguous(substrate, residue=None, offset=None)[source]¶

Returns True only if the phosphorylation site is stimulatory and not inhibitory.

ptms_lookup()[source]¶

Looks up the PTMs on array in the databases data. Creates list with kinase-substrate interactions targeting the substrates on array.

ratio_having_terms_of_category(proteins, cat)[source]¶

Returns the ratio of the proteins in list proteins that have been annotated with any terms in category cat.

read_coeffvar()[source]¶

Reads coefficient of variation values for each pair of spots.

read_data(name, col, row, ncol, nrow, vcol)[source]¶

Reads a data table with its annotations.

read_functional_categories(reread=False)[source]¶

Reads a set of functional categories defined by GO terms.

read_idmapping()[source]¶

Reads the mapping between the assay custom names and standard IDs (UniProt and Entrez Gene).

read_normalized()[source]¶

Reads the values normalized to median.

read_organism_specificities()[source]¶

Reads the organism specificities of the assay probes. These are either for human, mouse, rat, or any combination of these.

read_psites_diffs()[source]¶

Reads the measured values for each phosphosite at each condition.

read_raw()[source]¶

Reads the full xls table.

read_signals()[source]¶

Reads the mean of duplicates signal values.

read_tables()[source]¶

Reads all data tables.

read_xls(xls_file, sheet=0, csv_file=None, return_table=True)[source]¶

Generic function to read MS Excel XLS file. Converts one sheet to CSV, or returns as a list of lists

regulatory_sites(_reload=False)[source]¶

Loads the PhosphoSitePlus regulatory sites data. Data about the phosphorylation sites on the assay is saved to ddRegSites.

set_path(fname, attr)[source]¶

Sets the path to a file in basedir.

sparsen_network(perc)[source]¶

Removes a portion of the edges based on certain conditions.

classmethod table_to_file(arr, fname, hdr=None)[source]¶

Writes contents of an array into file with header optionally.

targets_of_kinase(kinase_uniprot, on_assay=True, uniprots=False)[source]¶

Returns a set of one kinase’s targets.

Parameters:
  • kinase_uniprot (str) – The UniProt ID of the kinase.
  • on_assay (bool) – Return the targets only on the assay, or all from the databases.
  • uniprots (bool) – Return UniProts, or GeneSymbols otherwise.
terms_of_category(protein, cat)[source]¶

Returns the terms in one functional category cat one protein has been annotated with.

terms_with_ancestors(protein)[source]¶

Returns all GO terms of one protein including all their ancestors.

tidy_functional_array()[source]¶

Creates a tidy array from the functional data and exports it to file.

Converts simple values to strings a uniform way.

top_fc_venn(threshold=1.5, fname='FC_Venn.pdf', sign=<function Pex100.<lambda>>, title='')[source]¶

Creates a Venn diagram of the highest FCs by treatments.
